Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (mostly lost); single added white band near top of sherd and another at bottom of sherd; exterior: three wide concentric brown bands with inscription on one reserved area.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins University College London, UCL 736.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 58)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 720, no. 781)
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (p. 24, fig. 3)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1566) (phase 2)
